info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 8:59AM EST until December 27 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following counties, Henderson and Polk. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood- prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 851 AM EST, As rain continued to fall across the region after a 3 to 4 inch rain accumulation, streams, creeks and rivers were rising once again. Elevated water levels and developing flooding of low-lying areas will occur along the French Broad River, and along Mud and Bat Fork Creeks. In addition, rising water is expected along the Green River which flows into Polk County. - Some locations that may experience nuisance flooding include... Hendersonville, Columbus, Flat Rock, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Tryon, Saluda, Dupont State Forest, Valley Hill, Dana, Lake Adger, East Flat Rock, Mill Spring, Tuxedo, Crab Creek and Green Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
